intro: Astragalus chorinensis, commonly known as the Chorin milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus chorinensis is also valued for its ecological role in preventing soil erosion and supporting local biodiversity.
